instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
Hello 

I have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> That not starting at  all, it is not liquid damaged and have no physical problem.

I read some of the posts and didi some checked up some parts. I found out that  <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> is  0v but could not find out where the problem is.

Appreciate your help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
Using a genuine Apple 87W USB-C AC adapter?
What's the voltage and current consumption shown on USB-C ammeter?
All G3H and S5 rails have correct voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?
Post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> must be high, if not PCH doesn't start power on sequence.
Try original 87W charger.

Did you try to start with both charger and battery connected?
Does it charge the battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
I using an original 87W charger and tried to connect both batteri and charger , but no boot.

 I,m not sure what do you mean by if not PCH doesn't start power on sequence.

where the <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> start fr√•n, i could not really find out what component turn it on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
Post <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL>.
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> at same time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
"What voltage should i trigger 3.4v?"
???
"Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>..."

You can use <RESISTOR>R5226</RESISTOR>, or SW5200 pads, instead of power button.
Make only temporary contact.
